heading: IRA250I nn% OF STORAGE-CLASS MEMORY IS ALLOCATED
content:
Explanation

  The system detected high usage of the available slots in
  storage-class memory (SCM). This message is issued when at
  least 80% of all available SCM slots in the system are in use.

  In the message text:

  nn
      The percentage of SCM slots that are currently allocated.

  System action

  The system continues processing.

  System programmer response

  Consider using the CONFIG SCM(xxxM|G|T),ONLINE command to increase the
  amount of storage-class memory (SCM) available to the system.

  Source

  System resources manager (SRM)

  Module

  IRASTSCM

  Routing code

  2

  Descriptor code

  3
